title: 3 Ways to Make Rice Water for Hair and Skincare

steps.title: Soaking
steps.content: Soaking Soaking the rice at room temperature is the quickest way to make your own rice water. Any type of rice works great, so use whatever you have at home. [1] X Research source Rinse ½ cup (95 g) of uncooked rice in a strainer. Add the rice to a bowl with 2–3 cups (470–710 ml) of water. Let the rice soak for 30 minutes. Strain the rice water into an airtight container, like a bottle or jar. Store the rice water in your fridge for up to 1 week.

steps.title: Boiling
steps.content: Boiling Another way to make rice water is by boiling the rice to extract the starches and nutrients. However, you have to let the water cool down before you’re able to use it. [2] X Research source Rinse ½ cup (95 g) of uncooked rice until the water runs clear. Put the rice in a pot with 2–3 cups (470–710 ml) of distilled water. Set the pot over high heat until the water boils. Strain the rice water into a bottle or jar. Let the rice water cool completely. Store the rice water in the refrigerator for 1 week before getting rid of it.

steps.title: Fermenting
steps.content: Fermenting If you let the rice soak longer, your rice water becomes more concentrated with nutrients. Fermenting makes the strongest rice water, but it takes the longest. [3] X Research source Pour 1 cup (190 g) of rice into a strainer and rinse it thoroughly. Put the rice and 2 cups (470 ml) of water in a resealable container. Soak the rice for 24 hours at room temperature. Strain the rice water into a bottle or bowl with a lid. Refrigerate the rice water for up to 1 week.

steps.title: Wash your hair with shampoo.
steps.content: Wash your hair with shampoo. Use the shampoo you normally do when you shower, and rinse it out thoroughly. Starting with a clean head of hair will make your rice water treatment even more effective. [4] X Research source Avoid using any shampoos that contain protein treatments when you use rice water because it can make your hair more brittle.

steps.title: Massage the rice water into your hair and leave it for 5-20 minutes.
steps.content: Massage the rice water into your hair and leave it for 5-20 minutes. Spray or pour the rice water slowly over your head and rub it into your scalp. Be sure to coat all of your hair evenly. Then, let it sit for 5-20 minutes so your hair can absorb the protein and nutrients. [5] X Research source What hair types does rice water work for? Rice water is perfect for any hair type! Whether you have straight hair, curls, waves, or anything in between, rice water works for all textures. While your hair is absorbing the rice water, put on a shower cap and finish the rest of your shower routine.

steps.title: Rinse the rice water out of your hair.
steps.content: Rinse the rice water out of your hair. After 20 minutes, use warm water to wash out all of the rice water. [6] X Research source Avoid leaving rice water in your hair for more than 20 minutes because it can overload your hair with protein, which can make it feel stiff or brittle.

steps.title: Apply conditioner to your hair.
steps.content: Apply conditioner to your hair. Because rice water is starchy, it can dry out your hair if you don’t use a little conditioner afterward. Use your standard conditioner or rub hair oil into your hair to lock in the moisture. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Use the rice water once a week.
steps.content: Use the rice water once a week. Using rice water too frequently can overload your hair with protein, which can make it look dry or frizzy. Start off with a weekly application and see how your hair reacts. [8] X Research source If you notice your hair drying out, then try using a shorter application time or waiting for longer in between treatments.

steps.title: Smoother and silkier hair
steps.content: Smoother and silkier hair Rice water is rich in amino acids that bond with your hair to give it more shine and less frizz. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Stronger and healthier hair
steps.content: Stronger and healthier hair Rice water is rich in vitamins B, C, E, and K that help your hair grow. The amino acids in rice water also repair damaged follicles to help prevent breakage or split ends. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Faster hair growth
steps.content: Faster hair growth Rice water is filled with antioxidants and amino acids your body needs, so applying it to your scalp can help you absorb those nutrients even better. [11] X Research source The effectiveness of rice water for hair growth hasn’t been fully studied, so don’t rely on it as the only way to stimulate hair growth .

steps.title: Easier to detangle hair
steps.content: Easier to detangle hair Rice water treatments work like a deep conditioner to make your hair softer. When your hair feels soft and smooth, it’s a lot easier to comb through and remove stubborn tangles. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Better scalp exfoliation
steps.content: Better scalp exfoliation Hairstylist Candice Ayers notes that rice water works as a gentle exfoliant that can help remove dead skin and hair. This can make your hair look cleaner and shinier.

steps.title: Using rice water for hair originated in Japan.
steps.content: Using rice water for hair originated in Japan. According to research, using leftover rice water for washing hair was recorded during the Heian Period from 794 to 1185 CE. The court ladies who had floor-length hair credited their long locks to the rice water. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Wipe or spritz rice water on your face to clean and moisturize your skin.
steps.content: Wipe or spritz rice water on your face to clean and moisturize your skin. Apply the rice water as a toner after you wash your face with your normal cleanser. Wet a cotton ball or pad with the rice water and gently wipe your face to remove any leftover dirt or dead skin. Let the rice water air-dry and finish your skincare routine . What are the benefits? Skincare specialist Barbie Ritzman notes that, “rice water contains vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants that can nourish and improve the overall health of your skin.” She notes the following benefits: Rice water hydrates and moisturizes your skin, and it contains amino acids that strengthen your skin barrier. Ferulic acid and inositol in rice water can help lighten dark spots, hyperpigmentation, and uneven skin tone. Rice water can help reduce inflammation and alleviate itching. Rice water acts as a gentle exfoliant, so it removes dead skin and unclogs your pores.

steps.title: Drink rice water each day to help digestion and weight loss.
steps.content: Drink rice water each day to help digestion and weight loss. Boiled or fermented rice water works best for drinking since it has the most nutrients. Aim to have around 1–2 cups (240–470 ml) of rice water every day. Because the water contains starches and vitamins, it can improve your gut health and relieve digestion issues you’ve been having. [14] X Research source Rice water is low in calories and doesn’t contain any sugar, so use it as a substitute for sugary drinks. Drinking too much rice water could possibly lead to gas, bloating, or constipation.
